tuv.seg: Home Carer's Tax Credit
Creidmheas Cánach do Chúramóirí Baile

A Home Carer’s Tax Credit is a tax credit given to married couples or civil partners (who are jointly assessed for tax) where one spouse or civil partner works in the home caring for a dependent person

Is creidmheas cánach é Creidmheas Cánach do Chúramóirí Baile a thugtar do chúplaí pósta (a mheastar i gcomhpháirt lena chéile i gcomhair cánach) nuair atá céile amháin ag obair sa bhaile ag tabhairt cúraim do dhuine cleithiúnach
The tax you are liable to pay is calculated as a percentage of your income
Ríomhtar an cháin a bhfuil tú faoi dhliteanas é a íoc mar chéatadán den ioncam atá agat
A tax credit is deducted from this to give the actual amount of tax that you have to pay
Baintear creidmheas cánach as seo, rud a fhágann an méid iarbhír cánach a chaithfidh tú a íoc
A tax credit has the effect of reducing your payable tax by the amount of the credit
Is é an tionchar a bhíonn ag creidmheas cánach ná do cháin iníoctha a laghdú de méid an chreidmheasa
Read more information on how your tax is calculated
Cliceáil anseo le tuilleadh eolais a fháil faoin gcaoi a ríomhtar do cháin
A Home Carer’s Tax Credit can be claimed when:
Tugtar Creidmheas Cánach do Chúramóirí Baile do:
• The married couple or civil partners are jointly assessed for tax
• Cúplaí pósta a mheastar i gcomhpháirt lena chéile i gcomhair cánach
• One spouse or civil partner works in the home caring for one or more dependent people
• Bíonn céile amháin ag obair sa bhaile ag tabhairt cúraim do dhuine cleithiúnach amháin nó níos mó
• The home carer’s own income is under €7,200. A reduced tax credit applies if the carer's income is between €7,200 and €9,400
• Bíonn ioncam an chúramóra baile faoi bhun €5,080 sa bhliain chánach ina bhfuil an t-éileamh á dhéanamh agat
Carer’s Allowance or Carer's Benefit are not taken into account when determining the home carer’s income but they are taxable sources of income
Ní thógtar Liúntas Cúramóra san áireamh nuair atá ioncam an chúramóra baile á shocrú ach is foinse ioncaim inchánach í
This means that if you are claiming Carer's Allowance or Carer's Benefit, it will make up part of your jointly assessed income
Ciallaíonn sé seo n-áireofar é san ioncam a mheastar i gcomhpháirt le do chéile más rud é go bhfuil tú ag éileamh Liúntais Cúramóra
Who is a dependent person?
Cé atá ina d(h)uine cleithiúnach?
A dependent person is a:
Is duine cleithiúnach é:
• Child for whom Child Benefit is payable
• Linbh lena bhfuil Sochar Leanaí iníoctha dó/di
• Person aged 65 or over
• Duine 65 bhliana d'aois nó níos mó
• Person with a disability who requires care
• Duine le míchumas a bhfuil cúram ag teastáil uaidh/uaithi
A dependent person you are caring for cannot be a spouse or civil partner
Ní féidir leis an duine cleithiúnach a bhfuil tú ag tabhairt cúraim dó/di a bheith ina c(h)éile
They can however, be a relative by marriage, or someone for whom you act as a legal guardian
Is féidir leo a bheith ina ghaol de bharr pósta, nó duine lena bhfuil tú ag gníomhú mar chaomhnóir dlíthiúil áfach
Does a relative have to live with us to be a dependent person?
An gcaithfidh gaol a bheith ina chónaí linn le bheith ina dhuine cleithiúnach?
The dependent person normally has to live with you and your spouse or civil partner in the tax year in order to quality for Home Carer's Tax Credit
Go hiondúil caithfidh an duine cleithiúnach a bheith ina chónaí leat agus le do chéile sa bhliain chánach le bheith incháilithe don Chreidmheas Cánach do Chúramóirí Baile
A dependent person who is a relative can be cared for outside your home
Ach is féidir cúram a thabhairt do dhuine cleithiúnach atá ina ghaol agat taobh amuigh de do bhaile mar sin féin
However, if the person is not living with you they must live next door in a neighbouring residence, or on the same property, or within 2 km of your home
Mura bhfuil an duine ina chónaí leat, áfach, caithfidh siad a bheith ina chónaí béal dorais in áras cónaithe in aice leat, nó sa réadmhaoin céanna, nó taobh istigh de 2km ó do theach
In addition, there must be a direct communication link between you (for example, a telephone line or alarm system)
Chomh maith leis seo, caithfidh nasc cumarsáide díreach a bheith eadraibh (mar shampla, líne teileafóin nó córas aláraim
The Home Carer’s Tax Credit for 2017 is €1,100
Is é €810 an Creidmheas Cánach do Chúramóirí Baile i 2015
If the home carer earns income of up to €7,200 in their own right for the tax year, the full tax credit may be claimed
Laghdaítear an creidmheas cánach de leath d'ioncam an chúramóra baile a sháraíonn an teorainn seo. (Féach an sampla thíos)
However, if the income exceeds €7,200, the difference between the actual income and €7,200 is calculated and then halved. The Home Carer's Tax Credit is then reduced by that amount
Ní bheidh cúramóir baile le hioncam bliantúil de €6,000 incháilithe do Chreidmheas Cánach do Chúramóirí Baile iomlán ach beidh sé/sí incháilithe do chreidmheas cánach laghdaithe
If the home carer's income is €9,400 or more during 2017 then you cannot claim the tax credit
Laghdaítear ráta uasta an Chreidmheasa Cánach do Chúramóirí Baile de réir an méid sin ansin
You cannot claim the Standard Rate Cut-Off Point for dual income couples and the Home Carer’s Tax Credit
Ní féidir éileamh a dhéanamh ar Phointe Scoite an Ráta Chaighdeánaigh do chúpla le dhá ioncam agus ar an gCreidmheas Cánach do Chúramóirí Baile
Your local tax office will help you to determine which is better for you
Cabhróidh d'oifig chánach áitiúil leat fáil amach cé acu a thugann an leas in mó duit
You can see more examples of calculations in Revenue's IT66 leaflet
Conas iarratas a dhéanamh
You can claim Home Carer's Tax Credit by using PAYE Anytime, which is available through Revenue's myAccount Service. You can also complete Home Carer’s Tax Credit IT 66 claim form (pdf)
Is féidir leat an fhoirm éilimh IT 66 Creidmheas Cánach do Chúramóirí Baile (pdf) a íoschóipeáil freisin
Applications for the Home Carer's Tax Credit should be made to Revenue
Ba chóir iarratais don Chreidmheas Cánach do Chúramóirí Baile a dhéanamh chuig na gCoimisinéirí Ioncaim
